titles.title: Social Security Protection Act of 1994
To clarify that the expenses of administering the Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance programs are not included in the budget of the United States Government, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Operations.
Referred to the House Committee on Rules.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Legislation and National Security.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 8/12/1994--Introduced. Social Security Protection Act of 1994 - Amends the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1990 and the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (Gramm-Rudman-Hollings Act) to declare that no expenses of administering the old-age, survivors, and disability insurance (OASDI) programs shall be subject to sequestration, or reduction under sequestration, under the latter Act. Declares that no amendment made by this Act shall cause any adjustment to any discretionary spending limit.
